org.letras.ps.region
Class RegionProcessor

java.lang.Object
  org.mundo.rt.Service
      org.letras.ps.region.RegionProcessor
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.mundo.rt.IEmits, org.mundo.service.IConfigure
public class RegionProcessor
extends org.mundo.rt.Service
implements org.mundo.service.IConfigure

The RegionProcessor is the applications main entry point and is responsible for instantiating all relevant components that make up an instance of the RegionProcessingStage.

A RegionProcessor is composed of the following components:

  • RegionManager
  • PenAccessManager
  • IRegionBroker (e.g. SimpleRegionBroker
  • RegionSampleProcessor (one for each connected pen)

Configuration of the RegionProcessor is handled via the Mundo IConfigure service interface. This means, configuration options will be specified in the node.conf.xml. Specific components might include their own configuration options, however, the general configuration options will be processed here. Supported options are

  • log-level: The log-level to use for log messages
  • pap-zone: The Mundo zone in which pens will be discovered
  • rap-zone: The Mundo zone to which RegionEvents will be published
  • broker:
  • access: Rules for allowing and rejecting discovered pens (see IPenAccessConfiguration)

Constructor Detail

RegionProcessor

public RegionProcessor()
                throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException
No-argument constructor. The only reason for it to be publicly accessible is the instantiation policy of Mundo. Normally this constructor will never be used, use the getInstance() method instead. If the constructor is used after the singleton has been instantiated, it will throw an IllegalAccessException.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalAccessException - If this class has already been instantiated (instance != null), this should never happen, since the contract is to use the getInstance() method
